page.title: 01GAINSBOROUGH GAZATEER
page.content: Gainsborough is a small market town in the West Lindsey District of Lincoln- shire.It is situated on the East bank of the River Trent,and is an important inland port.The population of Gains- borough is about 17500-in 1901 it was over 20000.There is an open-air market every Tuesday and Saturday,and a cattle market every Monday.Gainsboro' is 18miles from Lincoln,33miles from Sheffield,14miles from Doncaster and Scunthorpe.There are 3 industrial est- ates;Bridge St-flour milling;Corring- ham Road-wallpaper,storage tanks,etc., Heapham Road-light industry.Oil is ex- tracted in the area,and coal has been discovered recently.The town has good road and rail links,and there is a small airport nearby at Sturgate.The town has great potential for develop- ment.At present most young people of ability find employment elsewhere.
